title: Business Productivity Training Course For Increased Profits
headline: This free self-paced course helps you discover the secrets of exceptional business productivity to increase profits.
description: In this free online productivity course, you will learn about the major productivity challenges facing companies. These problems cost companies millions a year. This course will teach you specific productivity skills, strategies and techniques, saving you time, money and hassle. IT covers the four key areas of productivity: productivity skills, project management, teamwork and communication.
courseDescription:
In this free online productivity training course, you will learn how the four key areas of productivity - namely, productivity skills, project management, teamwork and communication - come together to increase output and, ultimately, profit. Each section of this training course will give you an extensive list of tools, strategies and techniques that you can use to help your staff perform better in each of these critical areas. This course is designed to be very practical for leaders, managers or business owners.

With this training, you will learn how to make yourself and your staff more productive in the typical tasks that you do each day. There is an entire section on project management because project management takes a very specific set of skills. This training will give you an overview of these skills, as well as tips and strategies to help you get better results. You will also learn in great detail the soft skills of teamwork and communication that keep an organisation running smoothly.

If you are a leader, manager or business owner, this is the perfect course for you. This training will give you the valuable skills needed to boost staff performance and company profits. These strategies and techniques can be used in virtually any organisation, whether corporate, state or non-profit.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

  • Productivity Training - Focus & Efficiency

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Productivity - Learning Summary

    • The average employee does just under 3 hours of productive work daily
    • Employees spend/waste almost 1/3 of the day checking emails
    • Self-discipline & time management are crucial to productivity
    • Prioritizing, to-do lists and scheduling keeps employees efficient and on track
    • Removing distractions and keeping a clean office/desk boosts productivity
    • Keep meetings brief and action step focused
    • Multitasking does not work
    • Using the cloud saves work from being lost and aids in collaboration
    • Set deadlines and track daily results

  • Project Management - Learning Outcomes

  • By the end of this section students will be able to:
    • State the importance of focusing on the outcome and setting realistic expectations
    • Discuss the importance of having all the details and identifying requirements
    • Describe the best practices for setting up deliverables
    • Discuss the importance of communication and how to avoid role creep
    • Describe the best practices for project organization and documentation
    • Identify ways to manage your time wisely
    • Discuss the importance of providing support to staff
    • Describe what is meant by "Critical Milestones"

  • Project Management - Begining Concepts and Setup

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Project Management - Key Skills

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Project Management - Learning Summary

    • Project failures cost the US economy $150 billion a year
    • Only 58% of US Organizations fully understand the value of project management
    • Project management has an intense focus on outcomes, details, deliverables and accountability
    • Being able to anticipate & solve problems is a key project management skill
    • Project managers must be highly organized and document everything
    • Project managers set expectations, create schedules and hold staff accountable
    • Project managers are realistic and support their staff


  • Teamwork Training - Learning Outcomes

  • By the end of this section students will be able to:
    • Discuss how to create proper rules and improve the team process
    • Explain the best way to define roles and distribute tasks among your staff
    • State how to build a feedback process
    • Describe why it is important to distribute tasks evenly
    • Explain how to share to-do lists
    • Discuss why open communication is so important
    • State why a clear vision and goals improves teamwork
    • Explain how the team process works
    • Recall team building strategies


  • Teamwork - Stats & Beginning Concepts

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Teamwork Training - Getting The Staff Involved

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Teamwork Training - Team Building

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Teamwork Training - Flexible Teams

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Teamwork Training - Learning Summary

    • 86% of empoyers identify lack of collaboration or inefficient communication as the top cause of workplace failures
    • 54% of employees say that a strong sence of community helps them stay at a company longer
    • Distributing tasks evenly is key to teamwork. It prevents any team member from feeling unfairly burdened
    • Sharing to-do lists allows team members to collaborate and communicate better
    • Clarifying goals and vision is key. Team members need to know why they are doing what they are doing and understand the big picture to be most effective
    • Managers need to make sure staff knows which tasks are due and when
    • Staff members need to have clealry defined roles to prevent duplication of efforts and agruments
    • Managers need to be encouraging and reward staff and teams for good work
    • Team meetings, activities, traditions and events all foster team building


  • Business Communication - Learning Outcomes

  • By the end of this section students will be able to:
    • State the importance of using surveys
    • Discuss why non-verbals are often the most important part of the communication
    • Describe why honesty and respect improve communication
    • Discuss the proper way to give feedback for the best results
    • Describe the best practices for assigning tasks
    • Explain what "Intention-Based Communication" means
    • Discuss the importance of selecting the appropriate venue to speak to the person in
    • State why learning to disagree is a key skill
    • Analyze why it is important to never assume

  • Communication - Stats & Beginning Concepts

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Business Communication - Working With Staff

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Business Communication -  For Managers

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Business Communication - Relationships

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Business Communication - Learning Summary

    • 69% of managers are not comfortable communicating with their employees, make sure your managers get training in this area
    • 33% of employees believe that a lack of honest or transparent workplace communication negatively effects morale
    • 46% of employees leave meetings rarely or never understanding what they are supposed to do
    • Non-verbal communication is as important, or more important, than verbal communication
    • Active listening is one of the best skills to acquire to boost your communication results
    • Being open, honest, respectful and empathetic is key to good communication
    • Learning to disagree, without being disagreeable, is a key skill
    • Constructive feedback should be based on actual facts and observations, not personal judgments
    • Surveys can get you honest information from employees that you could not obtain otherwise
    • Common communication issues include, out-of-control emotions, lack of focus and negative body language
    • Be clear with employees on exactly what you want them to do. Have them repeat it back to you.
